text:
I can't seem to disconnect from telnet. I'm logged on to SunOS 5.8,

It logon ok, then I <write>exit</write> to terminate the session.
It just goes back to "logon:...".

How do I terminate the session?

Thanks,
Benjamin
creator: benjachi@yahoo.com

text:
You should disconnect automatically from the session, no need to issue a 
command. btw, I think it's 'quit', not 'exit'.

See the following:

    <telnet server="pop.wanadoo.fr" port="110">
      <write>user stephane.bailliez</write>
      <read>OK</read>
      <write>pass xxxxxxx</write>
      <read>OK</read>
      <write>list</write>
      <read>messages</read>
      <write>quit</write>
      <read>OK</read>
    </telnet>


telnet:
   [telnet] user stephane.bailliez
   [telnet] +OK
   [telnet] pass xxxxxxxx
   [telnet]  POP3 server ready (NPlex 2.1.130) <7c3727f.1026644812000@mel-
pop9.wanadoo.fr>
   [telnet] +OK
   [telnet] list
   [telnet]
   [telnet] +OK
   [telnet] +OK 0 messages
   [telnet] quit
   [telnet]  (0 octets)
   [telnet] .
   [telnet] +OK
creator: sbailliez@apache.org
benjachi@yahoo.com
text:
You telneted to POP server instead of the standard Telnet port 21.
The command are different.

Thanks!
Benjamin

Yes! I got it.
Here's the command:

   <write>exit</write>
   <read></read>
creator: benjachi@yahoo.com

text: Does it exit if you don't send any 'exit' command ?
creator: sbailliez@apache.org
benjachi@yahoo.com
text:
yes! that works too! Good thing you brough that up.
Thanks,
Benjamin Chi
